result.execSummary:
The defendant Christopher Thomas France was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Receiving or Concealing Stolen Property (<=$2500) [Modifiers: Repeater], a class A misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 943.34(1)(a).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

REQUEST TO ISSUE CIVIL JUDGMENT FOR COURT OBLIGATIONS - forwarded to Ali

Defendant Christopher Thomas France in court with attorney Daniel Gordon Mitchell.  Joy Hammond appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Deputy Court Clerk ssm.  

Defendant changes his plea to GUILTY.  Defendant examined as to his plea, advised of his Constitutional rights and the maximum penalty.   Court found that defendant knowingly, voluntarily and intelligently waived his rights.  Guilty Plea Questionnaire/Waiver of Rights and Addendum received and filed.  Parties stipulate to the complaint as a factual basis to sustain defendant's plea.  Court found defendant guilty and ordered a Judgment of Conviction be entered on the record.  

Sentencing proceeded.  Statements by the State, defense and defendant.  Defendant sentenced to serve 120 days in the House of Correction with credit for 2 days time served.  Court STAYED the sentence and placed defendant on Probation with the State of Wisconsin, Department of Corrections for a period of 1 year.
Conditions: 
*  AODA assessment/treatment deemed appropriate;
*  Pay all costs and surcharges or, if not paid, convert to a civil judgment.

Appeal rights given.  Notice of Right to Seek Postconviction Relief received and filed.
Justice Point Program - Pretrial Report dated 02/23/2016; received and filed.

Filed, State's Motion in Limine, State's Requested Jury Instructions and State's Witness List.  Final pretrial held.  Case remains calendared for jury trial on February 24, 2016 at 8:30 am in Branch 21.

Defendant Christopher Thomas France in court.  Alex T. Mueller appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
Defendant is advised that this case is assigned to Judge Protasiewicz, Branch 24.  Court reviewed the complaint and found probable cause.  Defendant received a copy of the complaint and was advised of right to counsel and maximum penalties.  Court entered a plea of not guilty on behalf of the Defendant.  Court reserves Defendant's right to file a substitution of judge pursuant to Sec. 971.20 until Defendant's next scheduled court appearance. He did not want to talk to the Public Defender today but he was  given a referral to the Public Defender's Office. Defendant MAY be Public Defender eligible. The case is adjourned for a Pretrial Conference in Br. 24.  Pre-trial conference scheduled for August 6, 2015 at 08:30 am.
SUMMONS MAILED. DEFENDANT ORDERED INTO ROOM 221 SAFETY BUILDING ON 7/14/15 @ 1:30 pm
